fields.summary: Experiment with deployment scenarios for DE (e.g. downgrades)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: see https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/GHS-6039+Highlight+for+Filters
fields.summary: OBSOLETE?? document (minor) changes to QUICK FILTER filtering

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I find the issue details pane on scrum boards pretty difficult to use.

1--I'd like to be able to configure which fields are displayed on the first tab. we don't use fix versions, so that is just taking up space. 

2--The fields in the first tab are not editable -- components, labels, assignee, reporter, etc. it's extra work to modify these things; i have to open the full issue view in a new tab, which is distracting from what I was trying to do: prioritize & edit tasks.

3--There is no way to resolve an issue from the planning board. If an issue is bogus, I have to first go to the full issue view so I can resolve it.

4--the tabbed interface is inefficient. 
      often i have to flip back & forth between the task description, comments, attachments, and subtasks. I think a single tab with collapsible sections would be much easier to use.

5--fields on the first tab take too much space. it shouldn't require 90px of vertical space to show 2 dates or 2 people. I realize there is the issue of how to display things when there are many custom fields, but that shouldn't preclude dense information display for the default/required fields.
fields.summary: scrum board: issue details

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: the classic boards had options to configure the way tasks were displayed. it would be great if that was possible in scrum boards. it would also be great if there was a visual indicator for tasks that are in-progress.
fields.summary: scrum board: configure the way tasks are displayed in Plan mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Many sites these days let you drag&drop or paste an image into an input field. This would make greenhopper/jira much, much easier to use. my desktop is littered with temp images I've saved just so I can upload them via the filepicker.

For example, github now does this. there are many 3rd party plugins to facilitate, it should be very trivial to implement.
https://github.com/blog/1347-issue-attachments
fields.summary: paste images into description box

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When configuring a board, I can choose to "Base Swimlanes" on either Stories or Queries. I'd like to have both types at once: one swimlane for each story (containing their subtasks) and another swimlane for bugs.

To me, the ideal Scrum board would be like this:
- Swimlane 1: Story 1 and its tasks
- Swimlane 2: Story 2 and its tasks
- Swimlane 3: Bugs
- Swimlane 4: Technical debt
fields.summary: Allow creation of separate swimlanes for stories (and their tasks) and bugs

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Per screenshot, that would be great if the users can have an overview about those issues either by viewing them in the issue navigator or individually.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to get an overview about the issues which the systems alerts the user while starting a sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Empowering project admins to enable Simplified Workflows opens the door to destructive possibilities.  If the operation could be undone then a global JIRA admin would be able to assist a project admin after an unexpected change.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Global Administrator I would like to undo the action of a project administrator who has enabled SImplified Workflows

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Please test Simplified Workflows functionality to ensure that it scales for large enterprise customers.  As an Admin I don't want my instance to go down or be slow because an inexperienced project admin does something unexpected.
fields.summary: As an Enterprise GreenHopper user I need to be assured that the act of a project admin enabling Simplified Workflows on a single project containing 200,000 issues will not adversely affect any users of the JIRA instance

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create an issue with story points value.
# Create and Start a Sprint, set the start date/time ahead of your system clock (for example 5 min). 
# Edit the story points for issue (make sure before the planned sprint starts).
# Observe the Sprint Report at this point (the story points will reset to zero)
fields.summary: Story Points will reset to zero after editing the story points before the actual start of the sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Revoke 'Schedule Permission' from the user.
# Go to GH board in 'Work' mode.
# Select any take there.
# Press 'E' on your keyboard => 'Edit Issue' will popup.
# Edit anything and click on 'Update'.
# The issue now is not draggable unless you refresh the page.

Also occurs when the user does have Schedule Permission, if the board is not ranked (no ORDER BY Rank).
fields.summary: Issues are not draggable between columns if the board is not ranked or the user not allowed to rank

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Symptom
In certain cases the 'Not started' story points shows wrong number

As an example: the total points should be '9.997' or '10' since it will take two number after decimal point, but it shows as '91.00'
!sprint.JPG|thumbnail!

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Set the 'Estimation Statistic' as 'Story Points'
# Create two issues:
** First issue with story point *'1.667'*
** Second issue with story point *'8.33'*
# Create a sprint for those two issues and start the sprint.
# You will see the 'Not started' story points shows '91.00', which it suppose to be '9.997'/'10'

h4.Diagnose
This is only happen when the third decimal number is >= '5' for the total story points, e.g. '0.665' or '0.667'. If the total story points as *'9.991'*, everything looks normal. 

However, when you start work on issue, let's say move the first issue to 'In Process', then the 'In progress' value will take '1.667' as '1.67' as expected. 
!sprint2.JPG|thumbnail!

h4. Current Workaround
Avoid to use a story points with more than two decimal.
fields.summary: Wrong calculation of the story points in sprint marker

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the ability to use the Ranking field is based on the Scheduling or the Resolve Issues Permissions.
In some cases, an organization need the ability to separate these permissions.
For example:
* I have two group of users, let's say 'groupA' and 'groupB'
* 'groupA' needs to set up the 'Due Date' for tickets ONLY (unable to rank an issue).  Then, they need to have the 'Schedule issues' permission.
* 'groupB' can Rank issues ONLY(unable to set a 'Due Date').  They also need to have the 'Schedule issues' permission.
* The problem is that when both of them have the 'Schedule issues' permission, they will be able to Rank the issues and also set the 'Due Date' at the same time.

Having an additional "Rank issue Permission" would cover the need.
fields.summary: Specific permission to "Rank issue"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After upgrading from JIRA version 4.4.4 to 5.2.1 we see the following error on several (not all) configured boards.

{code}
An error occurredHide…(3)
Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'html' of undefined
Resource: http://jira/s/en_UK8t0occ-418945332/813/3/c443f55898e103c17c097ff22816cecd/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid/batch.js
Line: 2523
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'html' of undefined
Resource: http://jira/s/en_UK8t0occ-418945332/813/3/c443f55898e103c17c097ff22816cecd/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid/batch.js
Line: 2523
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'html' of undefined

Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.11 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/23.0.1271.95 Safari/537.11
{code}
fields.summary: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'html' of undefined

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When you have created a Lane on the board with multiple statusses, it is possible to choose on which status you drop it when entering from another lane. However when it is in the lane and there are two more statusses, I would like to drag it down to one of those statusses as well. Now I need to go into the menu and even to the other options, which is too cumbersome.

Is it possible to make the dragging within the lane on other statusses from that lane available?
Otherwise is it possible to add an easy accessible action item to change the status for a card on the board?
fields.summary: Multiple statusses in one Lane cannot be dragged upon within the lane

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When you have a lot of epics and one of the epics is finished (meaning all user stories and tasks are finished) you would like the epic to disappear from the view (or at least to be able to show and hide finished epics). 
I tried to close an epic and set the epic status to Done, but none of that worked, the epic is still shown.

Is it possible to create a filter button in the Epic view to show/hide finished epics?
And maybe an action on the epic should be to finish it, which sets the status to Done and the status to closed.
fields.summary: Epics remain on Agile Board even when they are closed and the Epic status is set to Done.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:
# install JIRA 5.1.7 and GreenHopper version 6.0.8
# create a custom field type Number Field(with Default Value, refer to NF.png)
# in Classic Planning Board, add the Number Field to the Card Styles . Refer to screenshot CardStyle
# in Classic Planning Board, create New Card. Number Field will have problem as per shown in the Problem.png . The Number Field will has error:
{code}
$action.getHtmlEncodedText($afield.getDefaultValue($boardIssue))
{code}

*workaround*:
Remove the Default Value from the Number Field

(i) This is not affecting GreenHopper 6.0.6, but *downgrading to 6.0.6 or below is not recommended* . Please also note that, Classic Board will be deprecated soon. Thus, please consider migrating to Rapid Board.
fields.summary: Number Field With Default Value Break in Classic Planning Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After an upgrade from GH 5.7.8 we created a whole bunch of scrum boards. All the boards cover the same Jira project, but are separated by filtering on a custom label-field. An issue shows up on only one board.

Two different boards created a sprint each, and somehow they got the same sprintId. Don't know if it is important, but this was sprintId=1.

Unfortunately I was unable to reproduce this in our test-environment but I wanted to report it anyway. I assume that because of the same sprintId, GH treated them as "the same sprint", leading to all kinds of unexpected behaviour.
fields.summary: Two different sprints ended up with the same sprintId (=1)

fields.description:
When user have a lot of issues in the 'Backlog' and multiple 'Sprints' , it's difficult to drag and drop them to a 'sprint' that you want. As a current workaround that we can use the 'send to top' option, but it will always deliver the issues to the top inactive Sprint instead of the Backlog itself. 

In this case, it will be grate to have a 'Sprint' box works like the 'Epic' box which allow user to drag and drop issues on the side of the board and when you scroll down the page, the 'Sprint' box will be following as the 'Epic' box, then we can easier to drag issues inside. 

To understand it better, here is a basic idea design on this:
!epic2.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: 'Sprint' box should works like the 'Epic' box which allow user to drag and drop issues on the side

fields.description:
Due to a typo, our rapid board is now owned by a user who cannot see the rapid board.  The original owner who changed the ownership to the wrong user cannot undo their change.  The new owner cannot undo the change because they cannot see the rapidboard.

I admit there might be some circumstances where one might want to set up rapid boards for users who can't see them _yet_ or something, but I think that's probably an edgecase.
fields.summary: Rapid board owners can be set to users who cannot see the board

fields.description:
I have reproduced this with 2 sprints of rather large size. Sprint 1 has 225 items (all bugs), sprint 2 has 125 items (stories). The workflow for bugs is the standard JIRA, the workflow for the stories us custom made. 

When attempting to remove an item from a sprint, either through the plan mode or work mode, the sytem times out with "read time out" error. This happens for any item in the sprint. Items have been manually transitioned through the workflow, as well as bulk transitioned. 
I have only reproduced this within one project so far. 

The item is not removed from the sprint. 

I have reproduced this with Chrome Version 23.0.1271.95 m and IE8
System is runing ubuntu 32 bit, a turnkey appliance.
fields.summary: "Read Time Out" when removing an item from a sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If you create an Field Configuration where the Description field is not used (hidden), then click on the issue in the Planning section or the Work section of a board to show the overview on the right side, the following error message pops up:

Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'html' of undefined
Resource: http://our_jira_instance/s/en_USbrpipe-418945332/812/12/10cf1b2c05fb553b6e0cd5d6edafe48d/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid/batch.js
Line: 2523

I've narrowed it down to being the missing Description field

{{var B=GH.DetailsModel.getViewField("description");var E=!!B.html}}

Basically B does not exist (no "description" field), so the {{html}} property can't be read
fields.summary: Issue Type Without Description Field Causes Javascript Error On Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Problem: certain JQLs can cause GH to not recognize all statuses for possible issue types.  For example:
{code}
project = cows  and ("steak selection" = Porterhouse OR issuetype=Improvement) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
* In the above JQL, only statuses for the *Improvement* issue type will appear in the column mappings.  Even if other issues types appear, their matching statuses will not appear
* Tested on GH 6.0.8

Steps to Reproduce:
* New JIRA instance
* Create new statuses
* Create new workflow
* Map new statuses to new workflow
* Map new workflow to an issue type
* Create Rapid Board, using a JQL similar to the above
* Check Status to Column mappings

See attached screenshots for a better explanation.
fields.summary: Certain JQLs result in Rapid Boards missing statuses that can be mapped

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Requested by a few third party developers working on plugins3
fields.summary: As a Connect plugin developer, I want to provide a panel in JIRA Agile's Issue Detail View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The new Greenhopper Rapid Board uses the 'Epic Link' field to relate a story to an Epic.

However, I like to directly edit the Epic while I am viewing a story in JIRA or edit it later on. Even I have add the 'Epic Link' to the create/edit issue screen. (As some users do not always edit stories in GH Rapid board only). Therefore It will be great if we can set or edit the Epic Link in the issue view page in JIRA.

At the same time, in the 'issue detail view' of Greenhopper Rapid board. You can delete the entry of the 'Epic Link' field in the detail view but cannot edit it, and you always have to go through drag and drop to the Epic.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the 'Epic Link' when creating or editing issue from issue view in JIRA

fields.description:
Why it is not possibility to have one permission to rank the issues in greenhooper? 

Sometimes the product owner takes care of the ranking but don't take care about due dates, because due dates can be also for subtasks and an agreement between the scrum team and an external. But as a product owner i don't want that the scrum team reranking the issues.
fields.summary: Unbind the ranking permisson from schedule or resolving

And then I would ne able to see a burndown of sprint / release or project
This was available in the Classic GH, and is missing in the new version
fields.summary: As a User I would like to group sprints into a release

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-6850].
  {panel}

A project admin user moves an issue from Project A to Project B when still associated with Rapid Board A.  The issue is added to the Project B rapid board.

Later a user in either Project A or Project B attempt to close their respective sprints in Project A or Project B rapid board.  They are each greeted with an error:

Error
To update this sprint you must have Project Administrator permissions for all of the following projects: Project A, Project B.

It would be better if the move did not result in a requirement for an admin in both projects to close the sprint.

Also reported here in Confluence Docs:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ending+a+Sprint?focusedCommentId=330795683#comment-330795683

This is really confusing to users because you can't remove the sprint from the moved issue unless that issue exists in some other board.

UPDATE: This also affects the ability to start sprint.

h3. Workarounds
* Do a *[Bulk Edit|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Modifying+Multiple+(Bulk)+Issues#ModifyingMultiple(Bulk)Issues-PerformingaBulkOperation]* on the moved issues to remove the value for the "Sprint" from those issues;
OR
* Add the "Sprint" field to the *Edit* screens associated with the issue types for that project you moved issues to and edit the issues and remove the value for the "Sprint" field;
fields.summary: Moving issue from project in rapid board to another project results in inability to close or start sprint for non admin

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Support have recently come into cases where the ranking chain in GreenHopper has broken when a database connection has failed.

ie:
{code}
2012-12-01 22:01:20,170 QuartzWorker-0 ERROR ServiceRunner     [NoModule] There was an error getting a DBCP datasource.
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to obtain a connection from the underlying connection pool
{code}

An error such as this will then result in a broken rank chain requiring a manual fix which is time consuming for support to perform on a case by case basis:

{code}

fields.description:
Consolidate properties file with the agile2012 replacements
Remove redundant code - only non Rapid names will be served
fields.summary: Remove redundant code from Rapid Board terminology change

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Improve REST test coverage of sprint CRUD functionality

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Message in the tooltip is not shown correctly when Issue Count is the estimate (screenshot)
Seen on JDOG
fields.summary: Epic progress bar text incorrect when Issue Count is estimate

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In order to manage our backlog, which can be quite large, we will create several Sprints on the Plan board and add items periodically as customer requirements get prioritized. Currently, only the active Sprint has the ability to be collapsed. It would be very handy to be able to collapse any Sprint that exists on the Plan board and then drag and drop tickets onto the collapsed Sprint of interest.
fields.summary: Collapse 1 or more sprints on the Plan board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like the ability to control click the tickets in the backlog to either drag or perhaps right click for a context menu to do things like move into existing sprint. This would allow users to perform actions on multiple tickets at one time.
fields.summary: Add controls to backlog view for better management

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
A sprint cannot be created with a time less than 'NOW'. We have several teams that sync the sprint dates but we don't create our sprints at exactly the same time. Allowing more flexible time handling when creating sprints would make coordination between teams much simpler.

*Workaround*

Edit the start date after creation. By doing this, you acknowledge that this will be listed as scope change within the sprint. The alternative is to backdate the Change History on the added issues.
fields.summary: Sprint creation times

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In past JIRA versions, we could drag tickets from the 'To Do' column into the 'In Progress' column and JIRA would update the assigned user to whomever did the dragging. That capability is not part of the new JIRA which increases the time it takes to manage tasks. In general, tasks may not always be assigned to the person who will be fixing it so allowing anyone to grab and drag tickets is essential.
fields.summary: Unable to move tickets from the Work board from 'To Do' to 'In Progress' without changing the user

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When a ticket is clicked in the plan board, the preview panel on the right appears. If I then want to edit the ticket, I have to click yet again and open it for edit. Why not make the preview not only editable but configurable so that I can pick what gets displayed for each tab, ie 'Details', 'Description', etc. I think this would save time and be much more intuitive.
fields.summary: Make the ticket preview panel in the plan board more usable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
GreenHopper provides a dialog off the welcome mat in order to create a project within JIRA.

The AddProject.jspa action has a src parameter which can be used to distinguish different ways of getting into AddProject in analytics. 

As a good JIRA analytics citizen, and to determine how many people create projects via GH vs. other methods, GH needs to add a "src" query param to each of it's usages of AddProject.
fields.summary: Raise analytics events for GreenHopper usage of AddProject

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a JIRA Admin, I want to be able to use some custom status field as a base for columns separation. The system status field is used for all development tickets (Open, In Progress, In QA, Complete, etc).

Meanwhile, Epics have an additional set of statuses as they represent a Release (Piepelined, Approved, In Ideation, In Execution, Under Review, Closed). So I would like to be able to create a Release Board with columns based on those custom statuses.
fields.summary: Ability to map custom field to columns on the board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi, I give you our scenario:
I created (not started) a sprint where an issue "a" is planned (assigned to me). This issue is linked to an issue "b" which is assigned to another one and is planned in another sprint. The other sprint (with issue "b" in it) was started. When I start my sprint (with issue "a" in it) the sprint with issue "b" is automatically completed and all issues fall back to backlog.
Is this a known bug or are we doing something wrong? But even when we doing something wrong, there should be a message or any warning before deleting another sprint.
I don' know if it is relevant but we are using a custom field named "target group" where we identify the team which handles the issue.
Greets Riccardo.
fields.summary: sprint kills other sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I am using Scrum board to manage our project issues. However, I found that the issue number link is struck-through every time when after I edited the issue. The issue status is neither closed or resolved/completed.

Is it a configuration problem or a bug? Thanks.

Enviroment: JIRA 5.0.2 with GreenHopper 6.0.4.
fields.summary: Strike-through on open/unsolved issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- Log in to JIRA and try to create an issue. The JIRA create issue form is displayed. !create_issue_jira.png!

- Now, go to ({{_Agile > Classic >_}}). Click  "Tools" and then "Configure". Disable the option *Card Creation*, to force creation of issues via JIRA.

- Click on the *Create Issue* button in JIRA. Greenhopper create card form is displayed !create_issue_gh.png!
fields.summary: 'Create Issue' button on Classic boards launches the Greenhopper form instead of the JIRA form even with Card Creation disabled

fields.description:
COS: 
- Wiki markup would be preferable 
- Some way to get at them and edit them from Plan, Work and Report modes
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to attach notes to my Sprint that I can see from plan, work and report mode to provide descriptive information

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS:
- manually triggered for a whole project
- show the number of issues to be updated before you hit go
- make it clear that this only migrates data that exists right now - it does not synchronise the relationships over time. also make it clear that it can be re-run at a later time if necessary.
- put in the global config in a new tab -- *Classic Epic Migration*
- explain what is about to happen when they proceed:
-- find issues with an issue key in the 'Epic / Theme' field then convert this to an Epic link. If a story is already linked with Epic Link field, ignore it.
-- server-side logging
- notify the Admin on confirmation page they should remove the Epic / Theme field (if it is no longer being used)
- modify description of Epic/Theme custom field so that it references Classic Boards

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Need to try with data from epics still in labs
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens when editing the old epic links?
A: (/) The old epic links can be updated but are not synced to the new style of epic link. Another migration is needed to port over the updated classic epic link (this will only work if the target issue has not yet been linked to a new style epic link)

Q: If you update classic epic links, will new ones be created as well from now on?
A: (/) No, there is no synchronization between old and new epic links

Q: What if there is old epic label data from when epics was still in labs (aka field is named something else)?
A: (/) Upgrade tasks will have migrated it. The migration uses the configuration of classic mode to find the classic epic link custom field

Q: Are there any differences with JIRA/AO versions we need to be wary of?
A: (/) Nope
fields.summary: As a Classic user I would like my epic-issue relationships migrated for use on the new boards

fields.summary: link Epics and stories in the tickets

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Have the ability to have Sub-Task included in a sprint without having its parent and siblings included in a sprint.
fields.summary: Sub-Task in a sprint

fields.description: As a user of the Rapid Board  iwould like to have gridlines for the reports/charts that are like the Chart board.
fields.summary: Gridlines for Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

If the user creates a different status and transitions an issue (that is in a completed sprint), the historical data will be affected. For example, the sprint report will show the completed issue as still incomplete.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create SCRUM project in Greenhopper with Simplified Workflow
!GH bug A.png|thumbnail!
# Create an issue, create a sprint, place the issue in the sprint, and complete the sprint
!GH bug B.png|thumbnail!
!GH bug C.png|thumbnail!
# Go to configuration of the Rapidboard and add a new status, for example, 'Finalized'
# Transition the issue from Done to Finalized
!GH bug D.png|thumbnail! 
# Move the Done status to the 'Unmapped status' column (it should indicate 0 issues using this)
!GH bug E.png|thumbnail!
# Now check the Sprint Report / Burndown chart / Velocity report from the Sprint that was closed. It will show it as incomplete
!GH bug F.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

# Transition back the issue from Finalized to Done
# Remove the 'Finalized' status
# Change the name of the 'Done' status to 'Finalized' 
# Check the Sprint Report, it should show up fine now with the new status
fields.summary: GreenHopper historical data is unable to recognize new status

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I had created a complex set of JQL queries to colour my issues by amount of story points but the were still being coloured by issue type.

After a while I figured out that it defaults to the "by issue type" setting if one of the JQL queries is invalid (no error shown).

The JQL query that was invalid was:

"Story Points" >= 0.5
fields.summary: Card Colouring via JQL query defaults to "by issue type" if JQL contains syntax error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have added three issues to my backlog (we do this by assigning a sprint team) in this order:

# CORE-1826
# CORE-1825
# CORE-1824

In the backlog these items appear in the wrong order:

# CORE-1824
# CORE-1825
# CORE-1826

I believe this is because the CORE-1824 ticket has been created at first and therefore has a lower value for the global rank field.

This would cause even more confusion if you add really old tickets to the backlog that have a way lower global rank and would appear within already prioritized items.
fields.summary: As a sprint manager I want issues that I add to the backlog to append at the end of it

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have had a lot of issues setting up the Scrum board so any tasks will show on the backlog (plan view). There seems to be a set up requirements you need on the tasks and project setup before anything will appear. Our problem was with the Sprint custom field was not applied for the project. Basically there should be better in app help to detect issues and help you fix them

* Anything required that would prevent an issue showing should be detected if possible and either have an option to fix it or instructions to fix

other related problem we found 
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/79301/why-are-bug-issues-not-visible-in-greenhopper-scrum-board-plan-view
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/43735/issues-not-showing-up-in-plan-view-of-rapid-board
fields.summary: Better setup assistance for Scrum Boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When hovering over an Issue Link, rather than seeing just:

View this issue in Jira: XX-NNNN

You should see

Jira: XX-NNNN 'Summary text'

IF this was implemented across the board then many of the reports will be instantly more useful as you then don't have to navigate to different pages to see what ID XX-NNNN refers to. 

A task ID on its own is much less useful in Agile development than it is in the Support environment. In Support the ID is often used as the basis for referring to a customer problem or ticket.

However, in Agile, the story summary is the main thing and IDs are more incidental.
fields.summary: Hover over Issue Link to show Issue Summary

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the Rapid Board reports, when actions are made against a sub-task it is shown in the update details below the chart. The action shows the parent task then the sub-task. The sub-task link is active but not the parent task. 

This request is to have the parent task link active and lead to the parent task issue view as well.
fields.summary: Burndown Chart: Parent and sub issue keys should be links in the data table

The editing mode of this field should size itself vertically so that as much of the description text/markup is visible without forcing the user to grab the edit box thumb (lower right) and drag it down. There's no reason for this extra step in my opinion."

Seems lower priority though.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-6791].
  {panel}

Here is the step to reproduce the issue: 
# Go to the field configuration and put the "Description" field to hidden.
# Create a Scrum board for the project 
# Click on any issue on the work / plan board the javascript error will appear like in the screenshot in the attachment file.
fields.summary: Scrum board throwing Javascript error when the "description" field of the issue is hidden

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is comparable to project templates in GreenHopper Classic.

The creater of a new Rapid Board does not have to care about correct column / status mapping and (color) visualization, but can simply rely on one or more named templates predefined by a JIRA system admin. that saves time and avoids errors.

I see, that today you can kind of bypass this problem by using the COPY function. but this has the same disadvantages as e.g. copying normal PowerPoint files over and over again by various persons, without knowing which is the most relevant / error free one. and the alltime risk, that you copy "crap". having a central QA'd template is much more robust.

It would also be good to be able to change the template for a Rapid Board after its creation.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I would like to use a predefined template for my Agile Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Lately, JIRA users are confronted with this message:

"The Classic boards are no longer being actively improved and are not recommended for use in new projects. Learn more about Getting Started with the new boards."

This is very irritating for our users, especially as they do not understand, what THEY should concretely do differently. when you have 2,000 users this is a real cost factor / waste.

please remove the message.
fields.summary: Please remove message "The Classic boards are no longer being actively improved ..."
